intro: Licania grandibracteata, commonly known as the giant bract licania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble flowers, which are actually modified leaves. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forests, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
